context:
* GBC's Liberal Studies electives enable students to expand and deepen their knowledge in humanities (LHUM), sciences (LSCI), and social sciences (LSSC).
* Students must complete Liberal Studies electives from at least two of the three categories and at least six non-core courses in total.
* At least three upper-level Liberal Studies electives are required to fulfill PEQAB's requirement for more than an introductory level of subject knowledge.
* Some Liberal Studies electives may have similar content as core courses, but it is the students' responsibility to ensure they don't repeat curriculum in their program area.
* Students who earn a grade of "B" or higher in two diploma-level General Education electives might be eligible for exemption from one Liberal Studies elective.
* The PEQAB breadth requirement applies, and program-mandated General Education courses cannot be transferred to fulfill Liberal Studies elective requirements.
* Students who transfer from a diploma to a degree program should consult Liberal Studies offices for advising about elective requirements as soon as possible.
* For graduates or students with completed diploma courses at another institution, transcripts and course descriptions must be submitted to the School of Liberal Arts and Sciences.
